name: Cellular Neuroscience

prereqs.text: (03-161 [] at least D) or (03-320 [] at least D) or (42-202 [] at least D) or (85-219 [] at least D) or (03-230 [] at least D)

long_desc: Modern neuroscience is an interdisciplinary field that seeks to understand the function of the brain and nervous system. This course provides a comprehensive survey of cellular and molecular neuroscience ranging from molecules to simple neural circuits. Topics covered will include the properties of biological membranes, the electrical properties of neurons, neural communication and synaptic transmission, mechanisms of brain plasticity and the analysis of simple neural circuits. In addition to providing information the lectures will describe how discoveries were made and will develop students abilities to design experiments and interpret data.

custom_fields.goals: Understand concepts in cellular neuroscience such as excitable membranes and action potentials Understand strategies of neural communication and neurotransmitter systems Understand the methods and approaches used to analyze neural systems. Understand the biological bases of some brain disorders. Describe the molecular basis of neural circuit function. Learn to develop testable hypotheses and to propose appropriate experiments. Learn to critically evaluate and assess graphical representations of data
custom_fields.key_topics: Membrane potential and IV plots, Action potentials, Na and K currents, Bursting neurons and sleep, AP conduction, myelin and glia, Synaptic physiology, Glutamatergic synapses, Synaptic Plasticity, LTP, Memory, Dopamine system, Synaptic Plasticity and Parkinson's Disease, GABAergic synapses
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Physiology, cell biology, or a university-level neurobiology course
custom_fields.assessment_structure:
10% Completion of in-class problem sets
20% Homework
10% Exam 1
15% Exam 2
20% Exam 3
25% Final Exam

Three exams will be given during the semester. You will be able to use your textbook(s)
during the exams, but no other materials will be allowed.
custom_fields.relevance:
In this course, you will learn about the properties of biological membranes, the electrical properties of
neurons, neural communication and synaptic transmission, mechanisms of brain plasticity and the
neural architecture of simple neural circuits.
